entry.summary: Ruby's experimental Ruby::Box feature offers a fresh approach to code reloading - instead of tracking constants, just load code in isolation and discard it afterwards. Here's what it makes possible, and where it still needs work.

entry.summary: Rubular set the standard for regex testing in Ruby. With Ruby 3.2 bringing WebAssembly support, Wubular takes that idea into the browser — no servers, instant feedback, full privacy. It’s not just a remake, but a glimpse of what Ruby + WASM make possible for future apps.
entry.title: Introducing Wubular: Rubular Reimagined in Ruby+WASM
